action.name: Weapon Attack
entries: {@atk w} {@hit 2 +PB} to hit, one target. {@h} damage depends on weapon, +2.

trait.name: Equal Progression
entries: Your Dearly Departed is considered to be the same level as you. When you gain a level, their hit points increase by {@dice 1d8} + their Constitution modifier. When you reach an Ability Score Improvement, your Dearly Departed also can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The Dearly Departed's spellcasting ability is either Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice, which increases that ability score to 14 (+2), spell save {@dc 10 + PB}). It can innately cast the spells learned from Spectral Training, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Appearance
entries: Your Dearly Departed has the appearance of when they were alive. As they take damage, they progressively appear to be more undead. At 0 hit points, their soul leaves the corpse, which then regains its original appearance.

trait.name: Spectral Training
entries: The Dearly Departed can equip and use the weapons and armor they are proficient with or the spells that they know, as displayed in the Spectral Training feature. They also have proficiency in light armor, Strength or Dexterity saving throws, and 2 skills of your choice.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the Dearly Departed to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, they drop to 1 hit point instead.
But our love it was stronger by far than the love
Of those who were older than we—
Of many far wiser than we—
And neither the angels in Heaven above
Nor the demons down under the sea
Can ever dissever my soul from the soul
Of the beautiful Annabel Lee;
For the moon never beams, without bringing me dreams
Of the beautiful Annabel Lee;
And the stars never rise, but I feel the bright eyes
Of the beautiful Annabel Lee;
And so, all the night-tide, I lie down by the side
Of my darling—my darling—my life and my bride,
In her sepulchre there by the sea—
In her tomb by the sounding sea.
Edgar Allen Poe, "Annabel Lee"

skill.special: {@dice +PB} to any two of your choice

subclassFeature.name: The Dearly Departed
entries: You have made a pact with the spirit of someone you loved, or with the god of death that was their jailor. This spirit's soul has been returned to you in the mortal plane, and is referred to as your Dearly Departed. Your Dearly Departed can be anyone of great importance to you, who passed away with unfinished business. In exchange for being reunited with this spirit, you must pay with your vitality. For every day that your Dearly Departed's soul is in the mortal plane with you, your lifespan is shortened by an equal amount. Once the business of your Dearly Departed is concluded and they are at rest, their spirit will leave the mortal plane and return to their eternal grave.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Your pact with your Dearly Departed or their jailor allows you to choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Training
entries: At 1st level, as their spirit now resides with you, your Dearly Departed shares some of the skills they learned during their life. Cantrips learned this way count as warlock cantrips for you, but they don't count against your number of cantrips known. Choose one of the following presets to represent your Dearly Departed:

entries.name: Jester
entries: You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} and {@spell minor illusion} cantrips. You can cast {@spell tasha's hideous laughter} once with this feature and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Mage
entries: You learn two of the following cantrips: {@spell acid splash}, {@spell fire bolt}, {@spell shocking grasp}, {@spell poison spray}, {@spell ray of frost}, or {@spell thunderclap|XGE}. You additionally learn one of the following cantrips: {@spell control flames|XGE}, {@spell gust|XGE}, {@spell mold earth|XGE}, or {@spell shape water|XGE}.

entries.name: Priest
entries: You learn the {@spell sacred flame} and {@spell spare the dying} cantrips. You can cast {@spell shield of faith} once with this feature and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Thief
entries: You gain proficiency with one {@filter finesse|items|type=martial weapon|property=finesse} or {@filter ranged martial weapon|items|type=martial weapon;!melee weapon;range;!simple weapon}. Once per round, you can deal additional damage equal to half your level (rounded down, minimum of one) to one creature you hit with a weapon attack.

entries.name: Warrior
entries: You gain proficiency with {@filter two melee martial weapons|items|type=martial weapon;melee weapon;!range;!simple weapon}, or {@filter one martial weapon|items|type=martial weapon;!simple weapon} and {@item shield|phb|shields}. You also gain proficiency with {@filter medium armor|items|type=medium armor}.

subclassFeature.name: Bittersweet Memories
entries: Also at 1st level, when you expend a warlock spell slot, your mind is flooded with memories of your Dearly Departed, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the spell slot expended.

subclassFeature.name: Only a Shadow
entries: At 6th level, your Dearly Departed has been given enough vitality to manifest itself. Once per long rest, you can cast {@spell animate dead} When casted this way, you follow all the rules of the {@spell animate dead}, with the following changes:

items: Upon creating your undead servant, your Dearly Departed's soul inhabits it, transforming the corpse's appearance into an exact replica of themselves when they were alive (creature statistics for your {@creature Dearly Departed|FrenchTech16DearlyDeparted} are below). You can only control one undead servant at a time this way. As your undead servant takes damage, their appearance progressively becomes more undead. When your undead servant's health falls to 0, it completely loses the appearance of your Dearly Departed and returns to being a regular corpse.

In addition, your undead servant has the personality and memory of your Dearly Departed. They can speak the languages they knew in life, they have skill and saving throw proficiences, they benefit from your {@subclassFeature Spectral Training|Warlock||Dearly Departed|FrenchTech16DearlyDeparted|1} feature, and they grow stronger as you level up, all of which is detailed in the Dearly Departed creature statistics.

If you do not reuse this feature on your undead servant after 24 hours, or if you lose control of your undead summon, your Dearly Departed's spirit will be forcibly ripped from the corpse, and it returns to being a usual {@creature zombie}.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Rule
entries: For aesthetic purposes or to make life easier on your DM, you can choose to not have your undead servant be able to speak, or only speak in short, garbled phrases. Perhaps once your undead servant is a higher level, they can speak more clearly, or maybe you need to rely on {@spell speak with dead}. That decision is up to your table.

subclassFeature.name: Restless Soul
entries: At 10th level, your soul has intertwined more strongly with that of your {@creature Dearly Departed|FrenchTech16DearlyDeparted}. You and your undead servant gain an additional benefit from {@subclassFeature Spectral Training|Warlock||Dearly Departed|FrenchTech16DearlyDeparted|1} based on the preset you initially chose:

entries.name: Jester
entries: Once per long rest, you can give yourself advantage on any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. You can use this ability after the original roll, but before the outcome is revealed.

entries.name: Mage
entries: When you cast one of your {@subclassFeature Spectral Training|Warlock||Dearly Departed|FrenchTech16DearlyDeparted|1} cantrips, you add your spellcasting modifier to the damage it deals.

entries.name: Priest
entries: You gain resistance to radiant and necrotic damage. When you cast {@spell spare the dying} to stabilize a dying creature, the stabilized creature also regains 1 hit point.

entries.name: Thief
entries: You learn a {@filter Fighting Style from the Ranger's list|optionalfeatures|feature type=fs:r}. You can't take a fighting style more than once.

entries.name: Warrior
entries: You learn a {@filter Fighting Style from the Paladin's list|optionalfeatures|feature type=fs:p}. You can't take a fighting style more than once.

subclassFeature.name: Ultimate Sacrifice
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you would fail your last death saving throw, if your {@creature Dearly Departed|FrenchTech16DearlyDeparted} is inhabiting your undead servant, they immediately sacrifice themselves, losing all their hit points and disintegrating. You are stabilized and heal an amount equal to half the hit points your undead servant lost this way (rounded down, minimum of one).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
